ETYMOLOGY: From Old French fait 'act, deed, exploit', from Latin factum 'a deed, thing done', neuter past participle of facere 'to do, make'.

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: An achievement that requires great courage, skill, or strength.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 一项需要极大勇气、技巧或力量的成就；壮举。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The successful completion of the marathon was a remarkable feat of endurance.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 成功跑完马拉松是一项了不起的耐力壮举。
